Description: Two fragments from two sides of belly of black-figure horse-head painted pottery belly amphora. On fragment 22: muzzle of horse, two narrow purple bands below panel. On fragment 23: muzzle and part of neck of horse.
Curator's comments: Six fragments from Tell Dafana in the British Museum (BM GR 1888,0208.92.a, 1888,0208.92.b, 1952,0505.22, 1952,0505.23, 1888,0208.105.a, 1952,0505.24) are from one-piece amphorae with panels containing the head of a bearded man or of a horse. Cook suggests that these fragments may belong to as few as two amphorae. The fragment Philadelphia E154.1, also from Tell Dafana, is from a similar amphora or from one of these amphorae (Cook CVA British Museum 8, p. 43).
"Bunbury" is pencilled on 1952,0505.22 and 1952,0505.23, and also noted in Register.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 609, 3-4)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 5)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Prof Charles Martin Robertson
Acquisition notes: Donated by Professor C. M. Robertson. He acquired it from a dealer who had in turn acquired it from Captain Bunbury, who had been given sherds by the Egypt Exploration Fund (See Cook, CVA British Museum 8, p. 57 n. 3 and p. 64 n. 3).
